title: Stop using .gitattributes for annex.largefiles config
body:
A `create` leaves the following config in the default branch:

```
% cat .gitattributes 
* annex.backend=MD5E
**/.git* annex.largefiles=nothing%                                                         

% cat .datalad/.gitattributes 
config annex.largefiles=nothing
metadata/aggregate* annex.largefiles=nothing
metadata/objects/** annex.largefiles=(anything)%                                           
```

The fact that this config is branch-specific is generally a disadvantage for datalad.

I propose to stop using `.gitattributes` for this and switch to `git annex config`. This will yield a subjectively cleaner dataset on create, translates to all branches, and causes less pain when additional configuration is done by users (or dataset procedures) that need to take a datalad-created starting point into account.

Unfortunately, there is no way to replace `annex.backend` settings in this way.
